basic.description: This course provides entering students in the PhD Program in Biomedical Sciences opportunities to be informed of and receive training in research by rotating through the laboratories of several individual faculty members in the department. Students must complete three laboratory rotations. Students should register for two semester hours of credit for each seven week rotation. May be repeated to a maximum of eight semester hours.
basic.subject: BMS
basic.title: Research Opportunities in Biomedical Sciences

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: Admission to the Biomedical Sciences graduate program.
